name: ActiveMQ on VM for on-prem
description: Messaging system used On-Prem are ActiveMQ on VM.

name: Kubernetes
description: Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications

name: Rancher Kubernetes
description: Kubernetes distro used on-prem.

name: AWS EKS
description: Amazon Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes (Amazon EKS) is a managed service that makes it easy for you to run Kubernetes on AWS without needing to install and operate your own Kubernetes clusters.

name: Istio
description: Service Mesh. Connect, secure, control, and observe services.

name: Docker
description: Docker provides an open platform for building, shipping, and running distributed applications.

name: Keycloak
description: Open Source Identity and Access Management For Modern Applications and Services

name: Grafana
description: Grafana allows you to query, visualize, alert on and understand your metrics no matter where they are stored. Create, explore, and share beautiful dashboards with your team and foster a data driven culture.

name: ActiveMQ Artemis
description: The Next Generation Message Broker by ActiveMQ. Look into use Artemis to support High Availability and Failover configurations.

name: Managed Amazon MQ on AWS environments
description: Messaging system used as managed service on AWS test systems. Replace Amazon MQ with  Active MQ on virtual machines outside the k8s cluster to be able to debug and keep enviroment similar.

name: ActiveMQ on VM for AWS enviroments
description: Messaging system used in AWS environment. Should be similar to On-Prem (ActiveMQ on Virtual machines), and not a AWS managed service.

name: Cilium
description: Traditional Linux network security approaches, such as iptables, filter on IP address and TCP/UDP ports. However, these IP addresses frequently churn in dynamic microservices environments. By leveraging Linux eBPF, Cilium provides API-aware networking and security by transparently inserting security in a way that is based on service, pod or container identity in contrast to IP address identification. By decoupling security from addressing, Cilium could play a significant role as a new network protection layer and we recommend you to check it out.

name: AWS RDS/Aurora
description: PostgreSQL as managed service on AWS

name: Postgres cluster
description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system with over 30 years of active development that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability, feature robustness, and performance.

name: Helm
description: The Kubernetes Package Manager

name: Helmsman
description: Helmsman is a Helm Charts (k8s applications) as Code tool which allows you to automate the deployment/management of your Helm charts from version controlled code. When going to Flux2, the use of Helmsman should be re-considered.

name: Git
description: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

name: GitLab
description: GitLab is an open source end-to-end software development platform with built-in version control, issue tracking, code review, CI/CD, and more. Self-host GitLab on your own servers.

name: Flagger
description: Progressive delivery Kubernetes operator (Canary, A/B Testing and Blue/Green deployments). Not really used.

name: Harbor
description: An open source trusted cloud native registry project that stores, signs, and scans content.

name: Chartmuseum
description: Part of Harbor

name: Polaris
description: Validation of best practices in your Kubernetes clusters

name: Black Duck
description: Black Duck provides a comprehensive software composition analysis (SCA) solution for managing security, quality, and license compliance risk that comes from the use of open source and third-party code in applications and containers.

name: Vault
description: A tool for secrets management, encryption as a service, and privileged access management

name: Jaeger
description: CNCF Jaeger, a Distributed Tracing Platform

name: Prometheus
description: The Prometheus monitoring system and time series database.

name: Kiali
description: Kiali project, observability for the Istio service mesh

name: FluentD
description: Fluentd is an open source data collector for unified logging layer

name: Splunk
description: Splunk is a software company that provides operational intelligence software that monitors, reports, and analyzes real-time machine data.

name: Splunk ITSI
description: Splunk is a software company that provides operational intelligence software that monitors, reports, and analyzes real-time machine data.

name: Snyk
description: Find and automatically fix vulnerabilities in your code, open source dependencies, containers, and infrastructure as code

name: Elastic as backend for Jaeger
description: Free and Open, Distributed, RESTful Search Engine

name: Lucene as backend for FHIR services
Elastic as backend as for FHIR services
Alternative to splunk for log consolidation
description: Currently SPLUNK is used for log coonsolidation. SPLUNK is expensive in licences and we may want to look at alternatives.

name: TerraForm
description: De facto choice for creating and managing cloud infrastructures by writing declarative definitions

name: OpenAPI Initiative
description: The OpenAPI Specification is used for e.g. SSL services. The OpenAPI Specification (OAS) defines a standard, language-agnostic interface to RESTful APIs which allows both humans and computers to discover and understand the capabilities of the service without access to source code, documentation, or through network traffic inspection. When properly defined, a consumer can understand and interact with the remote service with a minimal amount of implementation logic.

name: Java
description: The Java programming language

name: Kotlin
description: A programming language for the Java VM that makes developers happier.

name: Spring Boot Native
description: Native images provide various advantages like instant startup and reduced memory consumption. Spring Native is used to compile and build native images using Buildpacks and GraalVM's native build tools.

name: AsyncAPI
description: Open-Source tools to easily build and maintain your event-driven architecture. All powered by the AsyncAPI specification, the industry standard for defining asynchronous APIs.

name: Jenkins as deployment pipeline
description: Jenkins is currently used as deployment tool. Look into using Kubernetes operators instead (e.g ArcoCD, Flux2...)

name: Flux2 as deployment pipeline
description: Open and extensible continuous delivery solution for Kubernetes. Powered by GitOps Toolkit.

name: Cluster per environment for test environments
description: Seperate cluster for each non-prod environment - https://learnk8s.io/how-many-clusters

name: Cluster per Anvendersystem
description: Going from seperate namespace to seperate cluster for each telemedicine solution

name: One large Cluster for test environments
description: All workloads in same cluster for non-prod environment - https://learnk8s.io/how-many-clusters

name: Argo CD as deployment tool
description: Provides Web UI for real-time view of application activity
